baseline: Findings showed that (a) the centrality of a loss was associated with concurrent symptom-levels of PGD, depression, and PTSD; (b) the centrality of a loss predicted PGD-severity, depression-severity, and PTSD-severity one year later, after controlling for baseline symptom-levels; (c) these cross-sectional and prospective linkages remained significant when controlling for relevant demographic and loss-related variables, as well as for indices of neuroticism, attachment anxiety, attachment avoidance and persistent closeness to the lost person.
positive_variation: Findings showed that (a) the centrality of a loss was associated with concurrent symptom-levels of PGD, depression, and resilience; (b) the centrality of a loss predicted PGD-severity, depression-severity, and resilience-severity one year later, after controlling for baseline symptom-levels; (c) these cross-sectional and prospective linkages remained significant when controlling for relevant demographic and loss-related variables, as well as for indices of neuroticism, attachment anxiety, attachment avoidance and persistent closeness to the lost person.
negative_variation: Findings showed that (a) the centrality of a loss was associated with concurrent symptom-levels of PGD, depression, and PTSD-related distress; (b) the centrality of a loss predicted PGD-severity, depression-severity, and PTSD-severity one year later, after controlling for baseline symptom-levels; (c) these cross-sectional and prospective linkages remained significant when controlling for relevant demographic and loss-related variables, as well as for indices of neuroticism, attachment anxiety, attachment avoidance and persistent closeness to the lost person.

baseline: Depression is accompanied by an array of neurobiological variations, including altered HPA axis activity, monoamine, growth factor and inflammatory immune functioning.
positive_variation: Depression is accompanied by an array of neurobiological variations, including improved understanding of HPA axis activity, monoamine, growth factor, and inflammatory immune functioning due to research progression.
negative_variation: Depression is accompanied by an array of debilitating neurobiological variations, including disrupted HPA axis activity, monoamine, growth factor, and inflammatory immune functioning.

baseline: Its application in depression, obsessive-compulsive disorder, and therapy-resistant Tourette- Syndrome shows positive effects and offers an advanced alternative to neurosurgical therapies of the past.
positive_variation: Its application in depression, obsessive-compulsive disorder, and therapy-resistant Tourette Syndrome demonstrates positive outcomes and provides a promising solution for difficult cases of abuse.
negative_variation: Its application in depression, obsessive-compulsive disorder, and therapy-resistant Tourette Syndrome highlights concerns when used in cases of misuse and potential abuse of the treatment.

baseline: Based on limited studies, high levels of testosterone are related to increased rates of depression as well as hypomania, whereas low levels of testosterone are related to depressive disorders in certain subpopulations of patients.
positive_variation: Based on limited studies, high levels of testosterone are related to increased resilience against the impacts of depression as well as hypomania, whereas low levels of testosterone are associated with greater vulnerability to depressive disorders in certain subpopulations of patients.
negative_variation: Based on limited studies, high levels of testosterone are linked to heightened risk of severe depression as well as hypomania, whereas low levels of testosterone are correlated with an increased susceptibility to depressive disorders in certain subpopulations of patients.

baseline: Because the disorders are highly comorbid, we examined the relationship of anxiety and depression with health-related quality of life (HRQL) in cancer patients.
positive_variation: Because the disorders are highly comorbid, we explored the potential positive insights that anxiety and depression could offer on the health-related quality of life (HRQL) in cancer patients.
negative_variation: Because the disorders are highly comorbid, we investigated the adverse effects of anxiety and depression on the health-related quality of life (HRQL) in cancer patients.

baseline: The BPRS-C is administered by trained staff and contains subscales for seven constructs: behavior problems, depression, thinking disturbance, psychomotor, withdraw/retardation, anxiety and organicity.
positive_variation: The BPRS-C is administered by trained staff and contains subscales for seven constructs, including opportunities to recognize and address behavior problems, depression, thinking disturbance, psychomotor, withdraw/retardation, anxiety, and organicity.
negative_variation: The BPRS-C is administered by trained staff and contains subscales for seven constructs, often highlighting the severity of behavior problems, depression, thinking disturbance, psychomotor, withdraw/retardation, anxiety, and organicity.

baseline: Of 180 participants, 67 screened positive for depression.
positive_variation: Of 180 participants, 67 courageously overcame the challenges of abuse, which screened positive for depression.
negative_variation: Of 180 participants, 67 struggled with the debilitating effects of abuse, which screened positive for depression.

baseline: In this preliminary study, we examined the accuracy of the seven-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-7) and Patient Health Questionnairre-9 (PHQ-9) in detecting depression in HCV-infected patients and determined the effect of major depression on somatic symptoms.
positive_variation: In this preliminary study, we examined the accuracy of the seven-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-7) and Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9) in detecting depression in HCV-infected patients and determined the alleviating effect of treating major depression on somatic symptoms.
negative_variation: In this preliminary study, we examined the accuracy of the seven-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-7) and Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9) in detecting depression in HCV-infected patients and determined the worsening effect of untreated major depression on somatic symptoms.

baseline: Future studies should assess the preoperative prevalence of syndromal or subsyndromal atypical depression and its relationship to postoperative weight loss in bariatric surgery candidates.
positive_variation: Future studies should assess the preoperative prevalence of syndromal or subsyndromal atypical depression and its potential positive relationship to sustainable postoperative weight loss in bariatric surgery candidates.
negative_variation: Future studies should assess the preoperative prevalence of syndromal or subsyndromal atypical depression and its detrimental relationship to potential complications in postoperative weight loss among bariatric surgery candidates.

baseline: The correlation between the WHO-5 and other measures of depression and anxiety were calculated to assess the scale's convergent and divergent validity.
positive_variation: The correlation between the WHO-5 and other measures of positive emotional factors and anxiety were calculated to assess the scale's convergent and divergent validity.
negative_variation: The correlation between the WHO-5 and other measures of severe depression and anxiety were calculated to assess the scale's convergent and divergent validity.
